configurationItems.name: rpz_zonename

configurationItems.name: certificate_base64
configurationItems.description: Base64-encoded PFX certificate to be used for certificate-based authentication.

configurationItems.name: certificate_password
configurationItems.description: Password for the certificate used to authenticate

configurationItems.name: app_id
configurationItems.description: The application ID of the service principal that's used in certificate based authentication

configurationItems.name: block_expiration_days
configurationItems.description: How many days out should we set the expiration? A value <= 0 means to set no expiration.

name: MSDefenderOffice365_unblock
author: Joe Lazaro
description: Add entries to the Tenant Allow/Block List in the Microsoft 365 Defender

configurationItems.name: certificate_base64
configurationItems.description: Base64-encoded PFX certificate to be used for certificate-based authentication.

configurationItems.name: certificate_password
configurationItems.description: Password for the certificate used to authenticate

configurationItems.name: app_id
configurationItems.description: The application ID of the service principal that's used in certificate based authentication

name: MailIncidentStatus
author: Manuel Krucker
description: Mail a detailed status information of an incident case. The mail is sent to recipients specified by tags prefixed with 'mail='. The responder respects tlp definitions. For tlp:amber mail addresse and for tlp:green mail domains must be pre-defined in the configuration. For tlp:red sending mails is denied. The responser also uses thehive4py to collect information about the status of the tasks of the incidents.

configurationItems.name: from
configurationItems.description: email address from which the mail is send

configurationItems.name: smtp_host
configurationItems.description: SMTP server used to send mail

configurationItems.name: mail_html_style_tag_content
configurationItems.description: The css content of the style tag for the HTML mail body. Define table, th, hd, .first, and .second elements.
configurationItems.defaultValue: table { border: 1px solid black; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; vertical-align: top; th { border: 1px solid black; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left;} td { border: 1px solid black; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left;} .first { width: 150px; min-width: 150px; max-width: 150px; background-color: #ffe8d4; } .second { background-color: #d7d9f2;}

configurationItems.name: tlp_amber_mail_addresses
configurationItems.description: Mail addresses which are allowed to receive tlp:amber classified incidents

configurationItems.name: tlp_green_mail_domains
configurationItems.description: Mail domains which are allowed to receive tlp:green classified incidents

configurationItems.name: thehive_url
configurationItems.description: URL pointing to your TheHive installation, e.g. 'http://127.0.0.1:9000'

configurationItems.name: thehive_apikey
configurationItems.description: TheHive API key which is used get tasks and other elements of the incident

name: Mailer
author: CERT-BDF
description: Send an email with information from a TheHive case or alert

configurationItems.name: from
configurationItems.description: email address from which the mail is send

configurationItems.name: smtp_host
configurationItems.description: SMTP server used to send mail

name: Minemeld
author: Wes Lambert, Security Onion Solutions
description: Submit indicator to Minemeld

configurationItems.name: minemeld_indicator_list
configurationItems.description: Name of indicator list to which indicators will be added

name: PaloAltoCortexXDR_isolate
author: Joe Lazaro
description: Isolate endpoints identified by hostname or IP list

configurationItems.name: advanced_security
configurationItems.description: Set True if the API key was generated with Advanced security level. False for a Standard security key.

configurationItems.name: api_host
configurationItems.description: Fully qualified domain name for the API host. Example: api-example.xdr.us.paloaltonetworks.com

configurationItems.name: isolate_polling_interval
configurationItems.description: Interval, in seconds between requests for isolate or unisolate actions.

configurationItems.name: isolate_max_polling_retries
configurationItems.description: Maximum number of time to retry action status when the isolate or unisolate action is still in progress.

configurationItems.name: allow_multiple_isolation_targets
configurationItems.description: Allow the responder to send multiple targets for isolation/unisolation in one multi-line observable. Set to false as a safety mechanism to allow only a single endpoint to be affected while refusing requests to operate on multiple endpoints.

name: PaloAltoCortexXDR_scan
author: Joe Lazaro
description: Scan endpoints identified by hostname or IP list

configurationItems.name: advanced_security
configurationItems.description: Set True if the API key was generated with Advanced security level. False for a Standard security key.

configurationItems.name: api_host
configurationItems.description: Fully qualified domain name for the API host. Example: api-example.xdr.us.paloaltonetworks.com

configurationItems.name: scan_polling_interval
configurationItems.description: Interval, in seconds between requests for scan actions.

configurationItems.name: scan_max_polling_retries
configurationItems.description: Maximum number of time to retry action status when a scan action is still in progress.

name: PaloAltoCortexXDR_unisolate
author: Joe Lazaro
description: Unisolate endpoints identified by hostname or IP list

configurationItems.name: advanced_security
configurationItems.description: Set True if the API key was generated with Advanced security level. False for a Standard security key.

configurationItems.name: api_host
configurationItems.description: Fully qualified domain name for the API host. Example: api-example.xdr.us.paloaltonetworks.com

configurationItems.name: isolate_polling_interval
configurationItems.description: Interval, in seconds between requests for isolate or unisolate actions.

configurationItems.name: isolate_max_polling_retries
configurationItems.description: Maximum number of time to retry action status when the isolate or unisolate action is still in progress.

configurationItems.name: allow_multiple_isolation_targets
configurationItems.description: Allow the responder to send multiple targets for isolation/unisolation in one multi-line observable. Set to false as a safety mechanism to allow only a single endpoint to be affected while refusing requests to operate on multiple endpoints.

name: QRadar_Auto_Closing_Offense
author: Florian Perret
description: Closing the QRadar Offense associated to your case in one clic !

configurationItems.name: QRadar_API_Key
configurationItems.description: A QRadar API key with sufficent rights to close an offense

configurationItems.name: QRadar_Url
configurationItems.description: URL of your QRadar API, must be accessible from Cortex server. eg: myqradar.myorg.com/api/siem/offenses

configurationItems.name: Cert_Path
configurationItems.description: If you need a certificate to authentificate to your QRadar API, please provide the path here

name: RT4-CreateTicket
author: Michael Davis, REN-ISAC
description: Cortex Responder to create a ticket in RT4 from TheHive observables or alerts

configurationItems.name: Queue
configurationItems.description: Default queue in which to create new tickets

configurationItems.name: Owner
configurationItems.description: Default owner to assign newly created tickets (optional)

configurationItems.name: Status
configurationItems.description: Default ticket status to assign newly created tickets (optional)

configurationItems.name: custom_field_list
configurationItems.description: Name:Value of Custom Fields in RT to set on every ticket created (e.g.: 'How Reported:TheHive' sets CF.{How Reported} = TheHive on every new ticket)

configurationItems.name: tag_to_template_map
configurationItems.description: Mapping table of tags to templates (e.g.: 'phishing:phish_letter' maps anything tagged as 'phishing' to the 'phish_letter' template)

configurationItems.name: thehive_cf_rtticket
configurationItems.description: Name of a case custom field in TheHive in which RT ticket #s will be saved upon successful case-level Responder run (optional)

configurationItems.name: thehive_url
configurationItems.description: TheHive Base URL, e.g., https://thehive.domain.local:9000 (optional: only needed to process Cases)

configurationItems.name: thehive_token
configurationItems.description: TheHive API token for authentication (optional: only needed to process Cases)

name: Redmine_Issue
author: Marc-Andr DOLL
description: Create a redmine issue from a case

configurationItems.name: url
configurationItems.description: URL where to find the Redmine API

configurationItems.name: project_field
configurationItems.description: Name of the custom field containing the Redmine project to use when creating the issue

configurationItems.name: tracker_field
configurationItems.description: Name of the custom field containing the Redmine tracker to use when creating the issue

configurationItems.name: assignee_field
configurationItems.description: Name of the custom field containing the Redmine assignee to use when creating the issue

configurationItems.name: reference_field
configurationItems.description: Name of the case custom field in which to store the opened issue. If not defined, this information will not be stored

configurationItems.name: opening_status
configurationItems.description: Status used when opening a Redmine issue (if not defined here, will use the default opening status from the Redmine Workflow)

configurationItems.name: closing_task
configurationItems.description: Closing the task after successfully creating the Redmine issue

author: RiskIQ

configurationItems.description: API username of the RiskIQ Illuminate or PassiveTotal account (usually an email address)
configurationItems.name: username

configurationItems.description: API key of the RiskIQ Illuminate or PassiveTotal account

configurationItems.description: Visiblity for new RiskIQ Illuminate projects (analyst, team, or public).
configurationItems.name: project_visibility

configurationItems.description: Prefix to add when auto-generating project names from case names.
configurationItems.name: project_prefix

configurationItems.description: Tag to apply to artifact in TheHive when is has been pushed to a RiskIQ Illuminate Project (leave blank to skip tagging).
configurationItems.name: thehive_artifact_tag

configurationItems.description: Tag to apply to artifact in RiskIQ Illuminate when is has been pushed to an Illuminate Project (leave blank to skip tagging).

name: MailSentToSOC
author: sam
description: Mail a detailed status information of an incident case. The mail is sent to recipients specified by tags prefixed with 'mail='. The responder respects tlp definitions. For tlp:amber mail addresse and for tlp:green mail domains must be pre-defined in the configuration. For tlp:red sending mails is denied. The responser also uses thehive4py to collect information about the status of the tasks of the incidents.

configurationItems.name: from
configurationItems.description: email address from which the mail is send

configurationItems.name: smtp_host
configurationItems.description: SMTP server used to send mail

configurationItems.name: mail_html_style_tag_content
configurationItems.description: The css content of the style tag for the HTML mail body. Define table, th, hd, .first, and .second elements.
configurationItems.defaultValue: table { border: 1px solid black; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left; vertical-align: top; th { border: 1px solid black; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left;} td { border: 1px solid black; border-collapse: collapse; text-align: left;} .first { width: 150px; min-width: 150px; max-width: 150px; background-color: #ffe8d4; } .second { background-color: #d7d9f2;}

configurationItems.name: tlp_amber_mail_addresses
configurationItems.description: Mail addresses which are allowed to receive tlp:amber classified incidents

configurationItems.name: mail_address_to
configurationItems.description: Mail domains which are allowed to receive tlp:green classified incidents

configurationItems.description: URL pointing to your TheHive installation, e.g. 'http://127.0.0.1:9000'

configurationItems.name: thehive_apikey
